alert.note: Alert for Chuska Mountains; Far Northwest Highlands; Jemez Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama; West Central Mountains; West Central Plateau (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 25 at 2:05PM MST until February 26 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM TO 6 PM MST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations 1 to 3 inches across west central New Mexico and 2 to 6 inches across the Northern Mountains. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Northern and Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains, Chuska Mountains, Far Northwest Highlands, West Central Plateau, West Central Mountains, Tusas Mountains Including Chama, and Jemez Mountains. * WHEN...From 8 AM to 6 PM MST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Tire traction may be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. This includes along portions of I-40 near and west of the Continental Divide. Strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blowing snow could reduce visibility below one half mile. The heaviest snow and lowest visibility is expected along and behind a cold front where brief white-out conditions are possible. This cold front will track across western New Mexico in the morning, and across the Northern Mountains through mid day.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Chuska Mountains; Far Northwest Highlands; Jemez Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama; West Central Mountains; West Central Plateau
